Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified the roles (Accounts Payable Clerk, Purchasing Officer, Department Manager, AP Supervisor, Supplier Relationship Manager) and their respective descriptions of the process.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Mapped the sequence of steps described by Mary (Accounts Payable Clerk): receiving an invoice, checking for PO, logging into the system, forwarding to Purchasing, confirming receipt, matching invoice, resolving discrepancies, sending for manager approval.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Integrated Dan’s description of Purchasing’s role: verifying invoice details against the PO, contacting suppliers if discrepancies exist, confirming to AP, and handling missing POs.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyzed ambiguities about who contacts the supplier (Mary or Dan) when discrepancies arise, concluding that both may handle different aspects of supplier communication.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Validated that the department manager’s role described by Carlos fits logically after Purchasing confirms the invoice details and resolves discrepancies.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Hypothesized that escalation to Rita (AP Supervisor) includes collaboration with Karen (Supplier Relationship Manager) for supplier-related issues, based on Rita and Karen’s interviews.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Assumed a typical resolution flow for exceptions: discrepancies or missing info are escalated to AP Supervisor, resolved internally or with suppliers, then returned to the normal process.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Revisited Mary’s description of handling discrepancies and supplier communication to ensure consistency with other roles’ statements, resolving conflicts about escalation paths.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: Considered what would happen if discrepancies cannot be resolved. Hypothesized the process may require creating a retrospective PO or rejecting the invoice outright.
